page.title: 01Glanaman area-General Review
page.content: There are three distinct areas. {A. The Black Mountain.. { }Ground above approx. 240 metres. Within the Brecon Beacons National Park. Open heath and moorland. {B. Farmland. { }Ground between approx. 100 and 240 metres. Pasture and woodland. Sheep farming predominant. {C. Valley floor - Village of Glanaman. Ground below 100 metres. Valley runs from East to West. Contains River Amman and the A474, linking Ammanford and Pontardawe. {Glanaman}originally a{mining} community - 3 small, private mines remain. Village has a{school, hospital,}a few{shops}and{chapels.} Prediminantly{Welsh-speaking}area.
